website_summaries.verdict: Great sound quality and ideal for those looking for speakers for their turntable due to the RCA inputs.
pros: Speakers feature two sets of RCA inputs
13mm silk dome tweeter provides studio sound quality
Comes with remote control, speaker wire, RCA to RCA cable, and AUX to RCA cable
cons: There's no stop on the volume knob to know when you've hit the maximum or minimum volume levels

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a couple hours.
customer_reviews.text: They sounded great for a couple hours and then abruptly stopped working for no discernible cause. After playing around with all the connections, they appear to simply be broken. Going to have to send them back and try something else. Sound quality was excellent while they were working, though.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Bayley

customer_reviews.title: The sound is HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, these speakers suck. It doesn’t matter what size your room is - big or small - the sound is just bad. I connected this to my turn table, and the speakers sound worse than the actual turntable speakers. For the steep price these are a definite return. Such a bummer because the style is cool, but the sound is just BAD. Don’t waste the money.
customer_reviews.author: Singler77

customer_reviews.title: Reviews are misleading
customer_reviews.text: Based on the high reviews I thought okay I will finally decide to buy these things. They are priced very affordable. Connected to a 2012 Audio Technica AT-LP60 Fully Automatic Belt Driven Turntable. Sound quality terrible, no bass, no treble, sound quality one star if that. You pay for what you get, planning on paying $300.00 for BOSE bookshelves speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Kronas

customer_reviews.title: Such a good deal - Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good sound quality, amazing materials, substantial feeling, style Cons: Sound is good, but not great. For $100 speakers, they are incredible. Only RCA ports, no 1/4” or XLR. This is stated in the description, but it would be really nice to have those. Worth the money to just have them. Great value overall, but if you want something closer to professional, spend more to get those. For mid-level work they are fine, but don’t do any master EQing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Trashboat2373

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing sound
customer_reviews.text: Terrible whine coming from the speakers, not related to any ground loop issues. Played around with amps, pre-amps, etc., still hearing this whine.
customer_reviews.author: James Castle

customer_reviews.title: Volume stopped working after a year
customer_reviews.text: These worked pretty well for a year but now the volume is permanently stuck in low. Seems to be a malfunction in the actual brains of the speaker. Reached out to customer support and after asking me a follow up question they never responded. Pretty disappointed with this purchase, since all things considered I didn’t use them that much.
customer_reviews.author: RSpil

customer_reviews.title: Good deal. Read my review.
customer_reviews.text: I have a smallish living room and I can't even use these speakers at their full potential. For the price the sound quality is great. I also got a Bluetooth receiver and because these have 2 inputs I don't have to switch between my tv and the BT receiver. They're both always connected so I can use either my phone to steam music or the tv without the hassle of disconnecting and reconnecting.
customer_reviews.author: Panos Aps

customer_reviews.title: do not bother paying any more for "better " brands or larger size, these speakers kick butt
customer_reviews.text: recenently bought "state of the art" semi audiophile blue tooth speakers for 500 dollars for a pair....and although they have more bass and clarity , the overall mid range and vocals are actually not as good as these edifier R1280T bluetooth bookshelf speakers. they are kind of a miracle, and only after listening to this other pair, side by side , did i realize how really good the sound from these edifiers are. holy smoke. they made me start listening to music again because they are so much better than the single unit "stereo" blue tooth speakers that most of us are using these days to listen to music. ten stars, especially for the economical price point.
customer_reviews.author: bob macnutt

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money. Great upgrade from TV speakers
customer_reviews.text: These sound fantastic. Really good balance and clarity. Even my audiosnob brother with his 7.1 klipsch sound system was impressed with them. I bought these to run off a flat panel TV that had weak speakers. For the money I don't think I could have gotten anything better
customer_reviews.author: Chris Horsley

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely Bad Hi-Fi Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I can only guess that the positive reviews are from people who have never heard true high-quality computer speakers. The frequency roll-off at upper mid and high frequencies is appalling. THe deep bass just isn't there (little output below ~ 120 Hz?). These speakers sound as if someone stuffed a pillow in front of better-quality speakers. They are, however, cosmetically attractive and seem well-built.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry E

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Dynamic Sound...And let me tell you what wall mount I used!
customer_reviews.text: Great dynamic sound at a great price, just what I wanted as a novice audiophile just getting into the world of vinyl and analog sound/ live recordings. Comes with a remote which is handy. Looking through reviews before buying these, I wasn't seeing much about what mounts people were using, but I had great luck picking wall brackets that fit snugly. I used VideoSecu side mounting bookshelf speaker brackets, which are highly rated and are also found on Amazon:  Hope this was helpful! Get these and you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop listening to tinny music through your phone and buy these speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I received these as a gift over the summer and they are fantastic. If you want to actually listen to your music the way it’s meant to be heard, do yourself a favor and go this route rather than an all-in-one, kitschy cute player with built in speakers. These are so far superior, and you can really hear the dimensions and crackles and pops and the warmth that makes vinyl special. Literally the only downside to these is that the cords that attach them to the turntable itself are a bit short and that makes placing them a bit limiting. Other than that, these are a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: J T Rozier

customer_reviews.title: Nice but poor service.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound. Poor support. I bought a pair to use in my office and the sound was decent but it kept making a crackling sound or breaking up with some music, especially brighter vocals or when there were lots of strings playing, as in 18th century music or opera. Called twice about service. I was told someone would get back to me at a certain time. Nada. Never. Problem persisted. No help whatsoever, so I just returned the pair while I could. Too bad. I bet if you got a trouble free pair they'd be great.
customer_reviews.author: ahs77

customer_reviews.title: Decent but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Sound too muffled bass is decent but the highs are lacking upgraded my soundcard and then installed new equalizer for computer and now they are decent but the midrange is always lacking. Guitars don’t sound too good voices don’t jump out at you. Honestly the 85 dollar Logitech I set I have with the sub sounds better. When the sub is off these sound way better but with the sub on the sound is better than these. I would say 50 dollar speakers, they look nice for sure and get pretty loud nothing crazy but for a home office they do they job
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hans Wood

customer_reviews.title: Horrendously uneven responses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of all the positive reivews and the good price. The frequency response is uneven over most of the range of operation. 40Hz, response is zero. 60Hz, a loud spot. 70Hz is almost dead quiet again. 83Hz, another loud spot. 92Hz, quiet. 110Hz gets MUCH louder. 122Hz, back down again. This basically KEEPS GOING over the entire range (that I can hear, up to about 18 kHz). I'd expect this from a speaker with a punctured cone, but after inspecting these closely I can't find any signs of damage.
customer_reviews.author: TheJellys

customer_reviews.title: excellent value but may have problem can not decide.
customer_reviews.text: Overall excellent speaker for the money. BUT it does seem to have some type of issue. I do not know why but about 60 seconds into a song the volume and quality drops or so its seems to me. cannot understand what is going on. could be me or my five year old computer. also they did not recieve sound from line level output i am using the head phone out. may need a new usb dac or some other type of out put. they are still very good but i would like to know what is going on.
customer_reviews.author: richard westlake

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are used with a mix of streamed music and vinyl. They have a very crisp sounds that carries well throughout the room with enough low end to fill out the sound just right. The volume is capable of exceeding what is comfortable for a large room with minimal distortion. As someone who really cares about how well speakers sound, I was a bit hesitant to purchase a set from a company I was not familiar with but I am certainly not disappointed. I would recommend these to anyone wanting a set of powered monitors or bookshelf speakers in the ~$100 price range hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J.

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time (on a Sunday). Packaging was easy to open and just the right size, not too bulky. Unhooked the old PC speakers and connected these new ones from Edifier. What a difference! Was worth the money. Clear voices, nice bass, good treble, listening to music is just as enjoyable as listening to seminars and other audio items. Not much of a gamer, but I trust the speakers are good also for computer gaming use. For the price, 5 stars well deserved!
customer_reviews.author: KS from NOLA

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the money. Take a short amount of time to break in.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have met my expectations. They are loud and full sounding. I use them in conjunction with a bass guitar amp as a sub, via a aux cable splitter. That being said, they are plenty loud and bassy on their own. They took maybe 5-10 minutes of 'breaking-in' with music before the sound achieved a particular sort of fullness. I'm planning on replacing the included speaker cable with some higher quality 14 guage wire which I think will also help. Overall, I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: I gave these speakers five stars across the board. These are five stars for a compact, powered desktop speaker set. I am not comparing these to audiophile passive speakers attached to a quality stereo power amplifier. But, they are more than just "great for what they are." These speakers sound great attached to my computer. I love the bass and treble controls on the speakers. I haven't turned 'em way up 'cause I don't find recorded music pleasant at hearing damage inducing levels. At low to moderate listening volumes these speakers are pleasing. Smooth, clear, well-balanced. The sound remained stable as I ran the volume up higher than I plan to use them. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: critical shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice sounding powered speakers
customer_reviews.text: Fo around $100 these are great sounding little speakers. My usual set up is a VPI Scout through Focal Aria speakers but just needed something I could hook the iPhone or laptop to. Thought about Audioengine or Kanto but didn't want to spend the money on something that inevitably was going to sound inferior to my main set up. A decent cheap set of powered speakers is all I need. Didn't go for the Bluetooth option as I already have an adapter. Recommended as long as you don't expect $1000 sound from $100 speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Burke

customer_reviews.title: astounding !
customer_reviews.text: i bought these speakers to enjoy better sound when listening to amazon music hd during work long hours on the computer. what a gamechanger! these speakers are absolutely great, and for this price point (~$99), the best deal in a long time. solid build, conservative but sleek looks, all the cabling included, easy to hook up, definitely loud enough - in short if you are looking for great speakers for your computer, get them, you wont regret it. btw, if you happen to use linux as your main operating system, load pulseaudio pulseeffects and you have all the audio improvement capabilities to bring your listening experience to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Lafloer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the price might indicate
customer_reviews.text: These speakers do seem to be lacking in bass, but I adjusted it by +2 indicated on the control and that was just fine. I listened to The Jimi Hendrix Experiences "Voodoo Chile" (not voodoo child) a 15 minute experience of bass and feedback that should not be missed, and it sounded great. These are not audiophile speakers but they do allow you to hear parts of the music you don't usually hear with computer speakers. And they are also a bit lacking in highs, there seemed to be something missing when I listened to Linda Ronstadt and Carly Simon. Overall these are great, but not excellent speakers, and a good value. I would recommend these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: ZenDodge69

customer_reviews.title: Make a slab digital piano sound like a console piano...
customer_reviews.text: A sound renovation for your terrible slab digital piano speakers.... I have two digital pianos: a Yamaha DGX-650 with 2 way (12 cm x 2, 5 cm x 2) bass reflex speakers, which sounds good on its own; but the Casio PX-130 has only 13 cm x 6 cm one-way speakers which sound muddy in the highs and empty in the low end. Both systems have 8 W/channel. The Edifier R1280Ts have made the Casio sound better than the Yamaha, even with the slightly smaller woofer - the highs are clean and the bass present...a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap, these are good speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Stop! I get it. You're looking around for speakers. You're trying to figure out what will give you the best bang for you buck, and you have about $100 to spend, so you ended up here. Good. Stop. You found them. These are the ones you want. You're not going to find better speakers for this price range. You're probably not going to find better speakers until you've about doubled your price range. Seriously, these are just phenomenal speakers. Your search is over. Cons? Not really. You might need to get a longer speaker cable depending on where you want to install them. That's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Worked just long enough to beat the Amazon return date
customer_reviews.text: I liked them at first. They sound good for the price and they look nice. I purchased a new Yamaha receiver/amplifier and noticed there was a hum coming from the speakers. This was before I even hooked them up to the new unit. I went ahead and hooked it up, but no output from the speakers. With everything else powered down, they hum. I tried plugging them in to a different circuit. No luck. Looking at some of the other reviews, I can see that this has happened to others. The manufacturer has a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sanford Smith III

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at low volume, buy for quite quality not for clarity at high DBs.
customer_reviews.text: I find that mine are excellent sound quality up to the equivalent DBs of a dull roar. At "loud talking" volume, the quality starts to degrade. I think these are a good value for the money but in my opinion I shouldn't be hearing distortion at a "still comfortable" sound level. This observation coupled with my audio engineering experience, makes me seriously question that reliability of the reviews for the Edifier products. So while I wouldn't buy them again, I have to give them a decent rating. In short, if you have no other options, these will definitely do .. if you want to jam out at party volume, you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeromy Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed and connected the R1280T to my computer's sound system and I have got to say they are FANTASTIC! I don't normally write reviews, and I am hard to please: I have a pair of Klipschorns in my main sound room and a Yamaha C3 conservatory grand in the living room (I play for my church). I also have degrees in electrical engineering and math. These things sound good on anything you feed them: pop, rock, guitars, classical, movie soundtracks. The imaging is very good - I especially enjoyed the introduction to Boston's "Foreplay/Long Time". For classical they shined on Bach's Brandenburg Concert 6 in Bb Major. Two thumbs up! 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Freeda

customer_reviews.title: Outrageous sound quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a producer, used to listening critically on monitor speakers. I've worked on speakers that run $1000+ and heard a bunch of bookshelf speaker systems. The sound quality of these speakers is hard for me to believe, considering the price. They also look classy. If you're a producer or engineer: I wouldn't mix on them. But they do have fantastic separation of the instruments. The depth of the sound is great, and so is the stereo width. The sound of these out of the box is great, but if you do want to alter the frequency response, there are Bass and Treble knobs to tailor the speakers to your taste/your room.
customer_reviews.author: I Buy Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: This won't take any prizes for bass when compared to a subwoofer but if you are looking for tight mid-range and higher bass range this actually performs well. But where it shines is in the higher range. Bright without being shrill when you tune it a bit. Very nice for a computer or bookshelf vinyl setup. Worth the price for clean audio in a small package. Much better than similar priced computer speakers.
customer_reviews.author: virtigo

customer_reviews.title: OMG - JUST BUY THEM!
customer_reviews.text: After much research on bookshelf speakers for my new retro Victrola player, I purchased these Edifiers, and the sound is beyond expectations. I just wanted something simple to give my old 45s and LPs a little audio boost, and was I ever surprised. With any speaker system I have, I always crank both the bass and the treble to the max for the best sound. Works for me every time. The Edifier speakers do not bypass the Victrola speaker volume, so when turned-up together, the sound from all 4 speakers is surprisingly amazing. I didn't expect it. Just get them, and you will see what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: BOSTON-STRONG

customer_reviews.title: Great value for computer desk, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Set these up today, using them in place of cheap awful sounding typical computer speakers. They sound pretty good, though they are a bit muddy in the mid's, and a little harsh in the highs. Great for typical movie watching, and things like youtube, and video editing, but they are not replacements for home studio monitors. Overall I'm happy with them and would certainly buy them again. They draw around 4watts when turned on and sitting idle. They go plenty loud enough to fill a room with sound, and no distortion when at full volume. The cases seem to be built well, and they look great on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Remarkably solid, for their purpose...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these little speakers to connect to our big-screen TV, to provide better sound than the TV itself can do, and to eliminate the inherent vibration that TV speakers produce (which can shorten the life span of fragile circuit boards and internal electronic connections within the TV). Verdict...these little speakers are very good for this purpose. Notice, there is an extra remote to have in hand, and notice, these speakers are not big-room capable. But if you don't mind the extra remote, and if you just want solid living room or den sound from your TV, these speakers are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon B Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good speakers for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my bedroom. I wanted a speaker that could provide good punch at moderate volume. I tried another Edifier speaker, but didn't provide what I wanted. I read reviews of this one, and decided to try them. I replaced the speaker wire with 12g wire, and that made a noticeable difference. I also used clear rubber cones as feet to get them off the deck, and that added bass extension and improved the stage. I like these so far. I am waiting on my rca connector upgrade as well to connect my CD player, and the rca to mini cable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love them
customer_reviews.text: I tried twice with these speakers. The reviews were so good. The passive speaker just wouldn't play without a scratchy, almost unconnected sound. I thought I had received a defective pair, so I returned them for another pair. Then I read the one star reviews. All of them described my disappointment perfectly. Oh well, I guess you get what you pay for. I'm off to find better ones for my new Audio Technica turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Momtopj

customer_reviews.title: Horrible cables!
customer_reviews.text: Speakers are great, and sound fantastic. Perhaps a bit large for a desktop - they certainly don't wow me anymore than my previous Bose companion, which were 1/3 the size. The real issue lies with the cables provided. I was receiving horrible feedback (intermittently) and couldn't figure out the exact issue. Turns out it is the cheap cab;es provided. Replaced the red/white-rca cable (WITH WHATEVER i HAD LYING AROUND - NOT EVEN A QUALITY CABLE, JUST LEFTOVER JUNK!) and the problem vanished immediately. Factor in the cost of a new cable when buying these budget speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Josh English

customer_reviews.title: Sounds a bit muddy - treble control doesn't have great range
customer_reviews.text: Bought these instead of regular computer speakers since they have quite a bit of power and they had bass and treble control built in. While they sound very good, they do sound a bit more muddy than I would like. The range you get from treble goes from kinda muddy to REALLY muddy. I have to have treble turned all the way up to get these to sound reasonably crisp to my ears. Bass sounds good. Can be turned way down for night time listening, and when turned up it sounds very well balanced with the rest of the speaker. Had all the cables I needed to hook it up to my computer and to link the speakers together.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound and Superb speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, excellent sound and best of all perfect price on the unit. These are an amazing speakers for the price and sound as good as high end speakers. If you are on a budget and need some serious sounding speakers these are it. Look no further. They work superbly with the additional Chromecast audio devices that I have connected to the speakers for a whole house WiFi audio. I use the speakers mainly for for audio books and they sound better than expected. Insofar as music is concerned they sound great. Thank you seller and I would recommend you to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lenish

customer_reviews.title: Re-Review of Loudspeakers...
customer_reviews.text: These little monitors compare favorably to my other speakers. Good looking, shockingly good sound, very easy to hook up. My other loudspeakers are Bowers & Wilkins (B&W) DM603. ($1200.00/pair) WELL worth the money. After using these for several months, I've got to add that as good as the speakers sound, the remote is VERY POOR. I probably would not buy these again simply on the disappointing performance of the remote control. Unless it is pointed EXACTLY at the active speaker....nothing happens. It's easier to get up from my chair and adjust the volume manually at the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Clay

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but Micca PB42X are better
customer_reviews.text: My decision for small, powered speakers around $100 came down to these or the Micca PB42X. The Edifier's are very nice for the price, but the Micca's won for the most important reason -- sound. The Micca PB42X have better separation and clarity. Still, the Edifier's are very nice, with solid construction and separate bass and treble controls. Very nice unit for the price. Just not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kelly

customer_reviews.title: IT'S BROKEN.....
customer_reviews.text: I have being using this product since March 2019. In five months is "KAPUT". As a user, with no technical knowledge, simply plug and play, I am very surprised that Amazon sales this kind of junk. Now I have to go thru the inconvenience of sending this item to the originator ( manufacturer ) or whoever is responsible of the guarantee. The speakers response is the most standard type in the range of "common", compared other brands in the market. If any body can help to send this back please use the following contract: hlperez63@yahoo.com.
customer_reviews.author: h.l.perez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good price, look nice
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is as good as I can expect a speaker to provide - loud and soft, treble and bass, it seems rich and more than adequate for listening to movies, mp3s, cds and streaming music in my living room. I'm a normal user and these speakers have no obvious static or distortion, and they look respectable, pleasantly simple. Only downside is that the remote has a mute button and you cannot unmute the speakers except using the remote again. If you mute, then misplace the remote, you have turn off the speakers and turn them on again to get volume back.
customer_reviews.author: thewhitebear

customer_reviews.title: Very low volume if one does not crank up bass
customer_reviews.text: One reason I picked these speakers is so that I could adjust the bass, I do not like loud bass. The non bass sound quality is not very good at all, but if one wants they can boom the bass and get decent bass quality. The problem is that so much of the power is dedicated to the bass, that when I turn the bass down the overall volume is so low. I can hear it fine if I am next to it, but I have a much cheaper smaller set of speakers that gives me more volume a bit too much bass, but overall ok sound better than these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Keeney

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Received these speakers and got them connected to my turntable in record time. Sound quality is amazing for the size. Here is what I love about the Edifier R1280T Bookshelf speakers. A: I was able to connect two different products on the back. ie: Used the PC connection to my TV for quality sound when listening to Amazon Prime music, Pandora or Spotify B: The main power switch is on the back but on the main speaker (Right) I can power on or adjust bass and treble on the side with pulling it out. C: Has this cool remote with volume up/down and mute. You will be extremely pleased with these speakers and if not, Edifier will back them 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Huckleberry Ken

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value/ quality combination
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Bose powered desktop speakers that I was using for a turntable. This was mostly because they were small and well, they are Bose. I purchased these because the Bose had a bad connector. I was shocked that they were 1) at least as good as the Bose and 2) a bunch cheaper. I'm not an audiophile but I do know good sound when I hear it and these deliver without question. The bass/treble controls and remote are plusses. Don't hesitate to purchase these. They aren't overpowering but they are 'loud enough' and the quality of workmanship and sound is solid.
customer_reviews.author: 216Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Sound and build quality is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to cheaper Bluetooth speaker sound so these come across like a concert hall. Only disappointments are hardware volume just turns and turns (would rather have a definitive 0 to 10) and the speaker cable to connect them is dopey short. If you want any kind of sound separation then get some longer cable to go with it. Impressed enough with these speakers that I'll be getting another set for a new room later down the road. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Samas

customer_reviews.title: very mediocre sound
customer_reviews.text: I can't understand why these are rated so highly. (Maybe ALL powered bookshelf speakers are lousy?) Anyway these sound like cheap computer speakers. The bass is very muffled sounding. I will return these if I can find anything that might be better. A problem with higher end bookshelf speakers is they often don't have grills, which I want.
customer_reviews.author: A_user

customer_reviews.title: Fits, sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Two things I like: these small speakers fit on my desk at work. And they sound great at low volumes. And they look nice, that's three. I've only had this pair for a month or so, but the build seems solid, the materials OK. No drastic or even really noticeable outgassing of plastic fumes. Easy to hook up, of course, they're all the same in that regard, give a wire-connector type here and another there. I get in early sometimes, and have had these speaks turned up to about one-third, and done early-morning maniac writer dance to soul jazz, so I think the high-volume quality might be just fine, too.
customer_reviews.author: funkendub

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sound from these small bookshelf speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound from these compact size speakers. I bought them based on the positive reviews, and I was skeptical, since the woofers are only 4”. I wanted small active speakers remote controlled with good sound, and also suitable for making music too. Didn’t even felt the need to ad EQ. They’re very balanced with good bass, not too much, and they will be loud if you want them too. For even louder, you will have to go for their next model. These are their cheaper speakers, and I find them just right for my needs. For better sound, I would use better cables than the Rcas provided, and lower gauge/thicker speaker cable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: melodymaker

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bass, but not very clear
customer_reviews.text: Pro's Plenty loud for my teaching studio Look great, I like that the front grill comes off They do have a lot of punch, especially for the size Love the remote, simple but effective Easy access to the volume, treble, and bass on the side Cons: The only thing didn't like is that they lack volume in the high frequencies. I ended up turning down the bass completely, turned up the highs all the way, and then I increased the overall volume to get the highs to come out. Now they have a very nice full sound.
customer_reviews.author: K-man

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Good luck beating these for the $$ or even for twice the $$. I have large and mid sized, expensive brand, recording monitors in my studio, but I will buy another set of these to use as my small set. I got this set for my sons home studio to stop him from using headphones for everything. These are quite excellent.
customer_reviews.author: S. Asher

customer_reviews.title: An amazing value.
customer_reviews.text: No doubt I could recite a long, detailed and flattering review; but, frankly ... it's all been said many times over by other owners (see 4 & 5 star reviews) . My caveats to a 5-star are pretty much limited to the placement & design of the on-the-side controls. What I wanted when I ordered, was a good quality sound. What I think I have is a terrific sound and feeling like I somehow stole them at this price. You have complaints ?? Then spend $500 and you have room to complain. I think you will , as I do, feel pretty smug about having snagged these.
customer_reviews.author: JLuhn

customer_reviews.title: Sound is subjective but...
customer_reviews.text: Sound is subjective as well as musical taste and sound. One thing is for sure; these sound nice and balanced. The presence of bass is lacking but some may prefer that over bass centralized speakers or sound signatures. Nevertheless, these are built solidly and sound nice and warm. Unfortunately, I received a defective unit. One side would rattle and sound distorted at fairly high volumes. If bluetooth is not a priority for you and budget is your main goal then these will do fine. If you would like to spend a few extra dollars on a set of bookshelf speaker I'd recommend Edifier's higher end models.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice & attractive - great sound
customer_reviews.text: I got these for $64 on Black Friday. The sound is amazing for a little speaker set. Consider the fact that I have some decent Audiophile equipment like Adcom amps and B&W hand built speakers. This model has no optical input, so I had to waste another $13 on a converter. This is because new Samsung Premium 8 series UHD 4K TVs seem to believe that everyone uses futuristic connections and doesn’t bother with rca or headphones jack outs. They must’ve consulted the usb c only design team at Apple’s MacBook Pro design team.
customer_reviews.author: Bring back Funk music

customer_reviews.title: Exactly right
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile, but I always seem to have trouble finding speakers that don't over-amplify certain sounds. These do a great job of producing well-rounded, consistent sound. I don't think they're advertised as reference speakers, but they're certainly good enough to be. This means that if you want a party speaker, with a big, atmospheric, bassy party feeling, these probably aren't right. If you want to hear every detail in the music, or hear clarity and subtleties when it's loud or quiet, these are just right.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mudge

customer_reviews.title: Significantly Better than Bose
customer_reviews.text: I am a musician and I know quality sounds when I hear them. The Edifier 1280t is a fabulous speaker system for less than $100. Compare it sound wise to Bose, Bose is stinky!!! Bose needs a battery to function, the Edifier simply plugs in to your pc, or your tv, or your stereo system. I now own 3 Edifier 1280t sys, and my tv, my pc, my stereo system now all sounds great. I highly recommend this product! The bass is not overwhelming, the mid range is crystal clear, and the highs make me want to shout with joy!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Impressive speakers at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with these speakers! I purchased these to replace the popular Mackey speakers that died on me in less than a year. I had never heard of this brand but I’m sold now. I paired these with a subwoofer and an Audio Technica turntable and they sound great. I listen to mainly rock and classical and these sound impressive with both. Even on their own they have decent audible bass. I appreciate the little remote since I can’t get to the volume knob easily. For the price these are great speakers! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Good little speakers.
customer_reviews.text: These things are very nice little speakers. I am using it with my television for better sound, got it for my computer, but tried it on TV and it works great. Is this a studio monitor? Well no, but then I didn't pay for a studio monitor. The sound is much better than the TV speakers and having a remote to change the volume is great. This allows me to save energy so I can walk to the fridge for another beer. Thanks Edifier. Now if they could only motorize my recliner life would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: AKFred

customer_reviews.title: This will put Sonos out of business.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. I have decided to put speakers around the house and utilize Google Chromecast Audio devices to allow multi-room playback. These speakers are powered, so you don't need a stereo or amp. You just plug the Chromecast in and go. I use these in a large den and it is plenty loud. Not only loud, but good quality. My "go to" stereo setup are these Edifier speakers and a Chromecast. With a total cost of $134 this blows away the Sonos solution I was considering.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, no noise
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these as bedroom speakers in conjunction with my Amazon Echo Dot. These speakers met my main requirement that there be no noise or hiss from these speakers when nothing is playing, so they do not disturb my sleep. The excellent sound quality was a pleasant surprise. I hear sound elements in my music collection that I had never heard before. There's nice bass, and though the frequency response is flatter and lighter than the computer and TV speakers that I am used to, the overall effect is very pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Not for audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: These are good for people who don't care about audio fidelity and want something that looks good and has some bass. For the price, I guess they are pretty good. The bass overpowers the rest of the sound profile. Even with treble up and bass down all the way, the mids are missing. Decided I wanted to spend a little more to get something better. The JBL 305P MkII 5" monitors are $109 each (220 for the pair) and the sound is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Trini Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: When connected to music or videos the mids and lows are very muddy to my ears, and the highs just aren't there. Music that sounds great through my headphones sounds colored and mid heavy through these speakers. Not good at all in my opinion. I'm using it as a practice set up for my keyboards which is ok, but for studio monitors I say stay away.
customer_reviews.author: ultrasonoro

customer_reviews.title: they are great speakers with some major flaws in design for bookshelf speakers.
customer_reviews.text: these speakers sound great but have to major unthought out problems while using them. for one they give you a remote that only has mute and volume on it, no on and off button and since these are on my bookshelf the next major problem is they put the on and off switch on the back of the speakers instead of on the side where the other controls are so it makes it a bear when you want to shut them off when not in use. l have been unplugging them to turn them off since they are still drawing power when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: sir john

customer_reviews.title: excellent value. sound great.
customer_reviews.text: needed to get music into a room, discreetly and quickly. their compact size makes them great for putting them someplace inconspicuous. They sound pretty good for what they are, no complaints! they fill a 20 x 14 room with sound with no trouble (hardwood floors and little furniture). These are truly plug and play they come with everything you need. I plugged an apple airport express into them and its off the races. great value. Took off a star because i wish these had a standby mode. power switch is on the back. I just unplug them when not in use. Also wish they came with longer than 8 feet of speaker cable.
customer_reviews.author: KevinNJ

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with this sound quality at this price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after having them on my wish list for a while and finally decided to click “Submit Order” after seeing the speakers had an overall 4.5 stars out of over 1,900 reviews. I got them to replace the Micca 42X speakers I had connected to my PC which sounded very good. However, it only took a few minutes of listening to these Edifiers to realize they blow the Miccas away. They have very solid bass for their size, sound very spacious and have some of the best stereo separation I’ve ever heard. For this level of sound quality at this price, I don’t believe you could do any better.
customer_reviews.author: Rick H

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with these speakers
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with these speakers. The included aux cable is short so you might need longer cables. I went with this speaker over the other models for it's Bluetooth and it works really well. Bass and treble knobs to adjust those settings accordingly. For those interested in the bass performance I listen to a lot of reggae and dub vinyls and these speakers provide perfect amount of bass. Look and build quality are really nice as well. 5/5 super happy with these speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Seem rather heavy in box, which felt like a good thin
customer_reviews.text: Installed and played fine. Was looking for something decent, around $100, that HAS NO BLUETOOTH ---- Bluetooth, like all microwaves, causes cancer, headaches, insomnia, etc. These replaced the Bose 360 speaker, whose wifi bursting microwave dangerous cancer-causing noise can not be disabled, except by removing its battery (despite their claims otherwise, wifi on Bose can never be truly totally 'turned off' and continues to blast you 100% of the time no matter if Bose speaker is 'powered on' or 'powered off'.) Bought these speakers to escape being poisoned by Bose 360. wifi / bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Toxi Com

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular computer speakers and also good for a audio stereo
customer_reviews.text: These high ranking Edifier speakers are the real deal on quality. They are not perfect on sound separation but overall great for their class. Wonder about bass for them being small? No fear bass is here. Can be a bit muddy unless you turn down the bass. For the money these are nice speakers. Can`t think of any corners cut on quality. Want audiophile speakers? Get out the wallet and buy up to the $300 range at a minimum. I`d buy these again. Great sound for the size.
customer_reviews.author: whofan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, musical little beasts!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so stoked I discovered this company. Glad I wasn't using an adblock because I discovered them via a targeted ad. Anyway, just buy them - they are everything folks are saying about them. I'm now looking at their entire line in order to make a future gift purchase and maybe move into their higher end designs when I find more money. I'm feeding music to these via Chromecast Audio - streaming music from Google Play Music or Amazon music, though to these aging ears, Google Play Music is more dynamic through Chromecast Audio.
customer_reviews.author: ChuloHock

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: These sound great. Especially if you're considering buying the prime day deal at $70, go for it. I bought them at $100 and I'm even happy with them for that price. These will last many years, so invest now and enjoy high quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the price, and then some
customer_reviews.text: I use these as computer speakers. I replaced one of the old Creative Soundworks 2.1 systems I'd had for years. These are excellent. The sound in general, the dynamic range, the bass response, it's exactly what I was looking for Edifier is quickly earning a reputation as providers of some of the best speaker systems in the low-to-mid price range. Believe me, I've dabbled in the high-end audiophile range and for this purpose, at this price, I would choose these over the many-times-more-expensive bookshelf speakers I have in my listening room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Far too bass-heavy. Mid range is completely non-existent. Highs are buried under the bass, even with treble all the way up and bass all the way down. Serviceable, but maybe not that great for the price. The build is great, but the sound can't compare to the glitchy 23 year old Sony CFD-440 boom box it's replacing as speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Speck

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much as described and expected
customer_reviews.text: These are small, powered bookshelf speakers that deliver a nice sound although they do not have the boost or the range of more expensive speakers. For the price they are very pleasing. I am using them to boost the sound and range on a Crosley combination unit (phono, radio, cassette and CD) which has built in speakers. Combined this is a most acceptable unit for sound. A better remote would be ideal, but I understand a newer slightly upgraded version of this has a better remote.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L. Dolmetsch

customer_reviews.title: Clear, strong sound, well-built
customer_reviews.text: My primary purpose for these speakers was listening to music. Most reviews talk about gaming or watching tv but I honestly just needed good speakers to hear music on. These are solid as heck, the sound level is phenomenal for the price paid. If anything they're a tiny bit on the large size - I did check measurements before ordering but it's different seeing them in the space - but in this case I just didn't want to overspend for this particular application given that I have other ways to listen to music in high quality. If you're considering them, don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Really a wonderful value
customer_reviews.text: Using these primarily with my docked laptop, with the added enhancement of better converters via a Filo E17K DAC (which I've used on everything for a couple years now. Highly recommended). I'm an audio/recording engineer in my free time, and very particular about sound reproduction (short of spending the money to be a true "audiophile.") I love great sound, and these speakers deliver. Very warm, full, pleasing sound, but no hyping that could cause listener fatigue. I doubt there is anything of this physical size that will significantly outperform them, and certainly nothing close to this price point.
customer_reviews.author: F. Stuart Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good sound
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these speakers to replace a Samsung sound bar on a TV that had less than satisfactory sound quality that my wife watches a lot. I could not successfully connect the Samsung TV to the speakers using the supplied RCA plugs. After some research I bought a digital to analog audio converter and that solved the problem. These speakers are well made and the clarity of the sound is very good. Even the bass was superior to the sound bars powered sub woofer which surprised me.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: ... for my 600 sqft apartment and they did an excellent job filling the space with beautiful sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these monitors to replace my old stereo which was way too fricken huge for my 600 sqft apartment and they did an excellent job filling the space with beautiful sound. I listened to Bon Iver's "22, A Million" on vinyl as the first record to be played on the new system and was blown away. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Sorber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, beautiful looks, and simultaneous inputs!
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting this good for this little money. You will be blown away at the sound quality. Also, I went with this model over the bluetooth ones for two reasons. One, I think these look better. But more importantly, two, you can use both inputs simultaneously on these. No need to switch. Why that's important is I have one input being fed from my computer and my other from my Amazon Echo Dot next to it. No switches, splitters or anything else needed. Just sound when I want it! Only problem is I lost the dang remote! :) But hey... I just use the physical knobs on the side now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Not much bass
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Good looking. Nice highs and mids but almost no low end power. Even with bass at Max there was barely any bass when volume is moderately high. I listen to mainly extreme heavy metal and I want to hear the double bass from the drums and some power during the breakdowns. Also there's no sub out to add a woofer. Other than that they're ok speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound is excellent - no problems (yet) with speaker clips
customer_reviews.text: Albeit in a fairly small room, these speakers do a great job streaming from chromecast audio. Short of an expensive system with external amplification and a medium-high end DAC, I can't imagine a better sounding or looking solution. Like other reviewers, I'm a little concerned about flimsy speaker clips; I'd secure the wires with with a an extra bit of duct tape if you expect much stress or movement of the wires. Speaking of tape, the power light will capably illuminate your bedroom unless you cover it somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Citizen

customer_reviews.title: they are not of course able to blow you out of the room like my 7
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive bookshelf speakers for the price. I purchased them to replace an old Logitech 2.1 set the subwoofer had died on I had used many years for the computer/TV in the master bedroom. Turned them up to max with a movie on to try them out and no distortion, they are not of course able to blow you out of the room like my 7.2 in the family room, but are more than adequate for a bedroom setup without a subwoofer. The bass is crisp and the balance sounds fine with everything set to neutral.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: PROS/CONS YOU DECIDE!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: 1) These bad Beeches arrived in 19 hours, bravo amazon! 2) Box had a huge hole in it, but descent packaging kept the babes free of any damage, not one scratch! 3) Set-up took 3.5 minutes, not using a reciever just the onboard sound, 21W / side, way more than enough power! 4) I cannot put into words my experience when I fired these beechees up! but it felt similiar to an orgasm! 5) I would have easily spent $150 for these sweet boxes! CONS: Bass could have been a little beefier
customer_reviews.author: RepentTheresStillTime!

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from these, as I was looking for a cheap pair of monitor speakers to replace a set I moved to another room. When I started playing a song on these, I noticed parts of the song I had never heard before. The audio is super clear. I was absolutely blown away. They are easy to set up, and I love that you can hook these up with RCA cables or speaker wire. Absolutely recommend, and I will definitely be buying more Edifier products.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed - Great Bang For the Buck
customer_reviews.text: These speakers punch way above their weight class. I'm very impressed with the sound. I'm using them in a small entertainment area running an XBOX and an Alexa device into them. Sound is fantastic! I had previously tried some Bose speakers designed for PC, and returned them due to lack of range. These Edifier sound so much better. Music is crystal clear, balanced, and they have plenty of clear volume for my needs. I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but read the review to be happy.
customer_reviews.text: I am using these powered speakers for a CD changer and turntable. You must purchase a pre-amplifier for the turntable. I purchased a Pyle through Amazon for about $20. Other reviews have suggested a spliter to have both devices use the AUX input. Don't do this. Have your CD player use the AUX input and the Turntable / Pre-Amp use the PC input. This setup works well if sound quality is not your #1 priority. What this setup allows you to do is NOT need a large amplifier to power the CD and the Turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Jurewicz

customer_reviews.title: Best for the $$$$$$$
customer_reviews.text: I paired these with my Audio Technica turntable. I had it plugged into an old, bulky stereo system. I’m pretty new to vinyl. These speakers ROCK. They look amazing on my counter beside the fireplace and they sound great. I love that they have a remote to control the volume. I can really jam out to these little speakers. I did a lot of research on bookshelf speakers and think I got the best ones under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Justin I

customer_reviews.title: Decent Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of music production and have a home studio. I recently moved and am waiting to invest in a newer set of speakers. So I got these in the mean time and they are okay. I’m not upset with the amount of money I spent. I kind of wish I spent more on better speakers. The main thing I can’t get over is a constant static sound. I don’t know if that’s just my speakers or something going wrong in my set up and I wish I could figure it out but until I get new speakers these will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Malik

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Wow wow wow is all I can say. I am speechless. I have these attached to my computer that replaced the Bose Companions for the same price and it is night and day. These remind me of the Klipsh 2.1's I had years ago. I can't believe the sound and build quality of these. My computer room sounds like a theatre. I was so impressed I bought another set for my TV!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Classy but...
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have the quality anyone would expect. They also have the remote to adjust and mute volume. As you see on the speakers, they come with bass, treble and volume adjustment. I didn't notice any significant change using the bass or treble adjustment. You need to know that these DO NOT have balance adjustment. The system equalizes the sound to each speaker. If you must adjust speaker balance, you do not want these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: On the fence at the moment
customer_reviews.text: First item stopped working two days after receiving. On my second one right now. Fingers crossed that it lasts. All of a sudden the unit stopped playing anything, no matter what the input was. Tried many different variables. Want this to work so bad. I love the way it sounds for how small they are, and the price. Very full, and the speakers feel like they have a good weight to them. Here's hoping for the best!
customer_reviews.author: Randamage

customer_reviews.title: GREAT speaker!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a separate speaker/sub-woofer combo for my Soundblaster Z soundcard (PC).Tired of the 2.1 systems. Never heard of Edifier before this. Have never had a set of "Monitor" speakers though I am a discerning listener. Aside from usually getting Polks for my auto, I am thoroughly satisfied with the R1280T's. Bass/Treble/Volume adjustments on speaker, and a remote for volume? All for ~$99. Sold. If they only stand alone sold Subs. (I'm going with the 60W 10" Polk) I did buy a better cable from the get-go for speaker to PC. (Mediabridge) Now if only I can get everyone to leave the house...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Very strong sound
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for speaker replacements for years. I had an older box style speaker system, which worked well, but wanted something newer. Didnt want bluetooth or a big system, just 2 speakers that sound good. This was a great purchase, the sound is amazing for the size/price. Bass/Treble can be adjusted. Comes with a remote and aux cable I believe. You can get a converter for opitical to aux for like $10-15. I also use a chromecast audio to make a "speaker group". My house has like 8 speakers playing at the same time now.
customer_reviews.author: Kenji

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Spekers for my PC
customer_reviews.text: I listen to a lot of music on my PC and the ancient three piece Altec Lansing set had given their money's worth for many years but it was time to step it up. PLugged into my Alienware deaktop these speakers really up the game with clarity, power, and drive. Bass is great, midrange is super clear and the high end comes through. I am very happy with this pair of speakers on my desk - made even better from Amazon Warehouse deals. A++
customer_reviews.author: T. Wiz

customer_reviews.title: These rock!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife as she wanted better speakers for her Victrola record player. She has a lot of albums from the 70's and early 80's and the built-in speakers weren't cutting it. I looked on Amazon for some ideas and I came across these. I read the reviews and decided to give them a try. Out of the box they looked great, had some weight to them and the set-up was simple. I connected them to the Victrola, my wife picked out an album and we let it rip! For the price you can't go wrong! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Incredible speakers, great value!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a record player with bluetooth capabilities and wanted to find some great, inexpensive speakers to complement our new system. I have been so impressed with the quality and build of these speakers, they reproduce sound gorgeously, have good bass qualities and overall just sound amazing! I have to say, if you're a music snob, you may want to buy some higher-end speakers but for me these were perfect! I have found the sound quality to be amazing, and the value is unbeatable!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon H.

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker with giant sound
customer_reviews.text: I installed this to augment my TV's sound. The set-up was really easy and the sound is great - way better than I had anticipated. For a little speaker, this is just fantastic. I am going to buy another pair for my bedroom. I'm not an audiophile or someone who is looking for all the nuances that a music nut would. I just wanted good quality sound for my den and this certainly does the job. I feel like I'm in a movie theatre. I would revcommend this product to anyone who is looking make their TV experience a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a pair of speakers like this for a long time and I'm so glad I ended up with these. All the cables you need to connect this to your computer or another device are already in the box and you just need to spend 3 minutes connecting them together and making your desk look nice. The speakers have a beautiful finish and each has a definite weightiness to them that feels like a quality device. There's even a remote to control how loud they are ... because the knobs are on the side and slightly unreachable, depending on location. ...I wish I got the Bluetooth version now.
customer_reviews.author: Gorillamonk

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet
customer_reviews.text: really disappointed these speakers go great reviews but are super quiet. I have a set of M-audios that dont look as nice but sound way better. WIsh ive turned the volume all the way up on both my computer spotify and the speaker and its still disappointing. i have them turned up all the way right now and i can talk over them.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: The sound is amazing, a lot better than I would have expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers to use with my dad's old record player. The sound is amazing, a lot better than I would have expected. Even at high volumes the sound is very clear. I love the fact that the volume can also be controlled with a remote, helpful when I am standing across the room. Also the availability to use it with my phone or computer via AUX cord capability is wonderful as well. I will say that if you are buying these to use with a record player, you may need to buy a preamp. All in all I would highly recommend these speakers if you just need a basic speaker around the house to play tunes.
customer_reviews.author: lizzi

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For Christmas I got a record player and I needed speakers. After doing some Google hunting I ran into these. They sound great to me. They fill up the room and sound great. I'm no audiophile but people have commented how good they sound and that tells me they are good.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Wilco

product_meta.title: Edifier R1280T Powered Bookshelf Speakers - 2.0 Stereo Active Near Field Monitors - Studio Monitor Speaker - Wooden Enclosure - 42 Watts RMS
